required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Carboplatin and Gemcitabine Plus Bevacizumab in Patients With Ovary, Peritoneal, or Fallopian Tube Carcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Multicenter, Randomized, Blinded, Placebo-controlled Trial of Carboplatin and Gemcitabine Plus Bevacizumab in Patients With Platinum-sensitive Recurrent Ovary, Primary Peritoneal, or Fallopian Tube Carcinoma

brief_summary.textblock: This is a placebo-controlled, randomized, multicenter Phase III study that will evaluate the safety and efficacy of bevacizumab, administered in combination with carboplatin with gemcitabine, in women with platinum-sensitive recurrent epithelial ovarian, primary peritoneal, or fallopian tube carcinoma.

primary_outcome.measure: Progression Free Survival (PFS) as Determined by the Investigator, Per Response Evaluation Criteria for Solid Tumors (RECIST)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization through September 17, 2010 (up to 3 years, 5 months)
primary_outcome.description: PFS was defined as the time from randomization to disease progression (PD), as determined by the investigator, or death due to any cause. PD: At least a 20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum longest diameter recorded since treatment started; the appearance of 1 or more new lesions; and/or the unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions. Lesions were assessed by computed tomography (CT), magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), or ultrasound every 9 weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With an Objective Response as Determined by the Investigator, Per Response Evaluation Criteria for Solid Tumors (RECIST)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization through September 17, 2010 (up to 3 years, 5 months)
secondary_outcome.description: An objective response was the occurrence of either a partial response (PR) or complete response (CR). PR: At least a 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum longest diameter. CR: The disappearance of all target and non-target lesions. Lesions were assessed by computed tomography (CT), magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), or ultrasound every 9 weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Objective Response (OR) as Determined by the Investigator, Per Response Evaluation Criteria for Solid Tumors (RECIST)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization through September 17, 2010 (up to 3 years, 5 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of OR was analyzed in the subset of patients who achieved an OR. The duration of OR was defined as the time from the initial CR or PR until documented PD or death. Lesions were assessed by computed tomography (CT), magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), or ultrasound every 9 weeks.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization through July 19, 2013 (up to 6 years, 3 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival was defined as the time from randomization to death from any cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Who Had a Gastrointestinal Perforation (GIP)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization through September 17, 2010 (up to 3 years, 5 months)
secondary_outcome.description: A gastrointestinal perforation is a hole that develops through the entire wall of the stomach, small intestine, large bowel, or gallbladder.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Who Had at Least 1 Adverse Event
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization through July 19, 2013 (up to 6 years, 3 months)

arm_group.description: Carboplatin (AUC 4 mg/mL/minute) was administered intravenously (IV) on Day 1 of each of six 21-day treatment cycles. The carboplatin dose was calculated to reach a target area under the curve (AUC) of concentration x time according to the Calvert formula. Gemcitabine 1000 mg/m^2 was administered IV on Days 1 and Day 8 of each of the six 21-day treatment cycles. Bevacizumab 15 mg/kg was administered IV on Day 1 of each of the six 21-day treatment cycles. The bevacizumab dose was based on the patient's weight at baseline and remained the same throughout the study.

Carboplatin (AUC 4 mg/mL/minute) was administered intravenously (IV) on Day 1 of each of six 21-day treatment cycles. The carboplatin dose was calculated to reach a target area under the curve (AUC) of concentration x time according to the Calvert formula. Gemcitabine 1000 mg/m^2 was administered IV on Days 1 and Day 8 of each of the six 21-day treatment cycles. Placebo was administered by IV on Day 1 of each of the six 21-day treatment cycles.

intervention.description: Carboplatin was provided as commercially available drug.
Gemcitabine was provided as commercially available drug.

Bevacizumab was supplied as a clear to slightly opalescent, sterile liquid in glass vials (400 mg in 8 mL [25 mg/mL]) with a vehicle consisting of sodium phosphate, trehalose, polysorbate 20, and Sterile Water for Injection, USP.
Placebo consisted of the vehicle for bevacizumab without the antibody and contained sodium phosphate, trehalose, polysorbate 20, and Sterile Water for Injection, USP.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed Informed Consent Form
- Age ≥ 18 years
- Documented ovarian, primary peritoneal, or fallopian tube carcinoma that has recurred
- No prior chemotherapy in the recurrent setting
- Measurable disease
- Recovered from prior radiation therapy or surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior chemotherapy treatment for recurrent ovarian, primary peritoneal, or fallopian tube carcinoma
- History of abdominal fistula, gastrointestinal perforation (GIP), or intra-abdominal abscess
- Patients with clinical symptoms or signs of gastrointestinal (GI) obstruction or who require parenteral hydration, parenteral nutrition, or tube feeding
- Patients with evidence of abdominal free air not explained by paracentesis or recent surgical procedure
- Current, recent, or planned participation in an experimental drug study
- History of systemic bevacizumab (Avastin) or other vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF) or VEGF receptor-targeted agent use
- Inadequately controlled hypertension
- Prior history of hypertensive crisis or hypertensive encephalopathy
- New York Heart Association Class II or greater congestive heart failure (CHF)
- History of myocardial infarction or unstable angina
- History of stroke or transient ischemic attack (TIA)
- Known central nervous system (CNS) disease except for treated brain metastasis
- Significant vascular disease or recent peripheral arterial thrombosis
- History of hemoptysis
- Evidence of bleeding diathesis or significant coagulopathy (in the absence of therapeutic anticoagulation)

group.title: Carboplatin and Gemcitabine + Placebo
group.description: Carboplatin (AUC 4 mg/mL/minute) was administered intravenously (IV) on Day 1 of each of six 21-day treatment cycles. The carboplatin dose was calculated to reach a target area under the curve (AUC) of concentration x time according to the Calvert formula. Gemcitabine 1000 mg/m^2 was administered IV on Days 1 and Day 8 of each of the six 21-day treatment cycles. Placebo was administered by IV on Day 1 of each of the six 21-day treatment cycles.

group.title: Carboplatin and Gemcitabine + Bevacizumab
group.description: Carboplatin (AUC 4 mg/mL/minute) was administered intravenously (IV) on Day 1 of each of six 21-day treatment cycles. The carboplatin dose was calculated to reach a target area under the curve (AUC) of concentration x time according to the Calvert formula. Gemcitabine 1000 mg/m^2 was administered IV on Days 1 and Day 8 of each of the six 21-day treatment cycles. Bevacizumab 15 mg/kg was administered IV on Day 1 of each of the six 21-day treatment cycles. The bevacizumab dose was based on the patient’s weight at baseline and remained the same throughout the study.

participants_list.participants: One participant did not continue into the open-label treatment phase.

group.description: Carboplatin (AUC 4 mg/mL/minute) was administered intravenously (IV) on Day 1 of each of six 21-day treatment cycles. The carboplatin dose was calculated to reach a target area under the curve (AUC) of concentration x time according to the Calvert formula. Gemcitabine 1000 mg/m^2 was administered IV on Days 1 and Day 8 of each of the six 21-day treatment cycles. Placebo was administered by IV on Day 1 of each of the six 21-day treatment cycles.

group.description: Carboplatin (AUC 4 mg/mL/minute) was administered intravenously (IV) on Day 1 of each of six 21-day treatment cycles. The carboplatin dose was calculated to reach a target area under the curve (AUC) of concentration x time according to the Calvert formula. Gemcitabine 1000 mg/m^2 was administered IV on Days 1 and Day 8 of each of the six 21-day treatment cycles. Bevacizumab 15 mg/kg was administered IV on Day 1 of each of the six 21-day treatment cycles. The bevacizumab dose was based on the patient’s weight at baseline and remained the same throughout the study.

outcome.title: Progression Free Survival (PFS) as Determined by the Investigator, Per Response Evaluation Criteria for Solid Tumors (RECIST)
outcome.description: PFS was defined as the time from randomization to disease progression (PD), as determined by the investigator, or death due to any cause. PD: At least a 20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum longest diameter recorded since treatment started; the appearance of 1 or more new lesions; and/or the unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions. Lesions were assessed by computed tomography (CT), magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), or ultrasound every 9 weeks.
outcome.time_frame: From randomization through September 17, 2010 (up to 3 years, 5 months)
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat population: All patients randomized to treatment (242 patients in each treatment group).

group.title: Carboplatin and Gemcitabine + Bevacizumab
group.description: Carboplatin (AUC 4 mg/mL/minute) was administered intravenously (IV) on Day 1 of each of six 21-day treatment cycles. The carboplatin dose was calculated to reach a target area under the curve (AUC) of concentration x time according to the Calvert formula. Gemcitabine 1000 mg/m^2 was administered IV on Days 1 and Day 8 of each of the six 21-day treatment cycles. Bevacizumab 15 mg/kg was administered IV on Day 1 of each of the six 21-day treatment cycles. The bevacizumab dose was based on the patient's weight at baseline and remained the same throughout the study.

group.title: Carboplatin and Gemcitabine + Placebo
group.description: Carboplatin (AUC 4 mg/mL/minute) was administered intravenously (IV) on Day 1 of each of six 21-day treatment cycles. The carboplatin dose was calculated to reach a target area under the curve (AUC) of concentration x time according to the Calvert formula. Gemcitabine 1000 mg/m^2 was administered IV on Days 1 and Day 8 of each of the six 21-day treatment cycles. Placebo was administered by IV on Day 1 of each of the six 21-day treatment cycles.

measure.title: Progression Free Survival (PFS) as Determined by the Investigator, Per Response Evaluation Criteria for Solid Tumors (RECIST)
measure.description: PFS was defined as the time from randomization to disease progression (PD), as determined by the investigator, or death due to any cause. PD: At least a 20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum longest diameter recorded since treatment started; the appearance of 1 or more new lesions; and/or the unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions. Lesions were assessed by computed tomography (CT), magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), or ultrasound every 9 weeks.
measure.population: Intent-to-treat population: All patients randomized to treatment (242 patients in each treatment group).

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis was that there was no difference between the 2 treatment groups, ie, that the hazard ratio is equal to 1. The alternative hypothesis was that progression free survival was longer in the carboplatin and gemcitabine + bevacizumab group, ie, that the hazard ratio is not equal to 1.
analysis.p_value_desc: A P-value < 0.05 was required for significance.
analysis.method_desc: The analysis was stratified for time since the last platinum therapy (6-12, > 12 months) and cytoreductive surgery for recurrent disease (yes, no).
analysis.estimate_desc: The hazard ratio was estimated using Cox regression. The hazard ratio is relative to the carboplatin and gemcitabine + placebo group.

outcome.title: Percentage of Patients With an Objective Response as Determined by the Investigator, Per Response Evaluation Criteria for Solid Tumors (RECIST)
outcome.description: An objective response was the occurrence of either a partial response (PR) or complete response (CR). PR: At least a 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum longest diameter. CR: The disappearance of all target and non-target lesions. Lesions were assessed by computed tomography (CT), magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), or ultrasound every 9 weeks.
outcome.time_frame: From randomization through September 17, 2010 (up to 3 years, 5 months)
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat population: All patients randomized to treatment (242 patients in each treatment group).

group.title: Carboplatin and Gemcitabine + Bevacizumab
group.description: Carboplatin (AUC 4 mg/mL/minute) was administered intravenously (IV) on Day 1 of each of six 21-day treatment cycles. The carboplatin dose was calculated to reach a target area under the curve (AUC) of concentration x time according to the Calvert formula. Gemcitabine 1000 mg/m^2 was administered IV on Days 1 and Day 8 of each of the six 21-day treatment cycles. Bevacizumab 15 mg/kg was administered IV on Day 1 of each of the six 21-day treatment cycles. The bevacizumab dose was based on the patient's weight at baseline and remained the same throughout the study.

group.title: Carboplatin and Gemcitabine + Placebo
group.description: Carboplatin (AUC 4 mg/mL/minute) was administered intravenously (IV) on Day 1 of each of six 21-day treatment cycles. The carboplatin dose was calculated to reach a target area under the curve (AUC) of concentration x time according to the Calvert formula. Gemcitabine 1000 mg/m^2 was administered IV on Days 1 and Day 8 of each of the six 21-day treatment cycles. Placebo was administered by IV on Day 1 of each of the six 21-day treatment cycles.

measure.title: Percentage of Patients With an Objective Response as Determined by the Investigator, Per Response Evaluation Criteria for Solid Tumors (RECIST)
measure.description: An objective response was the occurrence of either a partial response (PR) or complete response (CR). PR: At least a 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum longest diameter. CR: The disappearance of all target and non-target lesions. Lesions were assessed by computed tomography (CT), magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), or ultrasound every 9 weeks.
measure.population: Intent-to-treat population: All patients randomized to treatment (242 patients in each treatment group).

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis was that there was no difference in the percentage of patients with an objective response between the 2 treatment groups. The alternative hypothesis was that a larger percentage of patients had an objective response in the carboplatin and gemcitabine + bevacizumab group.
analysis.p_value_desc: A P-value < 0.05 was required for significance.
analysis.method_desc: The analysis was stratified for time since the last platinum therapy (6-12, > 12 months) and cytoreductive surgery for recurrent disease (yes, no).
analysis.estimate_desc: The difference in response rates and the 95% confidence intervals for response rates were computed using the normal approximation to the binomial distribution.

outcome.title: Duration of Objective Response (OR) as Determined by the Investigator, Per Response Evaluation Criteria for Solid Tumors (RECIST)
outcome.description: Duration of OR was analyzed in the subset of patients who achieved an OR. The duration of OR was defined as the time from the initial CR or PR until documented PD or death. Lesions were assessed by computed tomography (CT), magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), or ultrasound every 9 weeks.
outcome.time_frame: From randomization through September 17, 2010 (up to 3 years, 5 months)
outcome.population: Subset of the intent-to-treat population: All patients randomized to treatment who achieved an objective response.

group.title: Carboplatin and Gemcitabine + Bevacizumab
group.description: Carboplatin (AUC 4 mg/mL/minute) was administered intravenously (IV) on Day 1 of each of six 21-day treatment cycles. The carboplatin dose was calculated to reach a target area under the curve (AUC) of concentration x time according to the Calvert formula. Gemcitabine 1000 mg/m^2 was administered IV on Days 1 and Day 8 of each of the six 21-day treatment cycles. Bevacizumab 15 mg/kg was administered IV on Day 1 of each of the six 21-day treatment cycles. The bevacizumab dose was based on the patient's weight at baseline and remained the same throughout the study.

group.title: Carboplatin and Gemcitabine + Placebo
group.description: Carboplatin (AUC 4 mg/mL/minute) was administered intravenously (IV) on Day 1 of each of six 21-day treatment cycles. The carboplatin dose was calculated to reach a target area under the curve (AUC) of concentration x time according to the Calvert formula. Gemcitabine 1000 mg/m^2 was administered IV on Days 1 and Day 8 of each of the six 21-day treatment cycles. Placebo was administered by IV on Day 1 of each of the six 21-day treatment cycles.

measure.title: Duration of Objective Response (OR) as Determined by the Investigator, Per Response Evaluation Criteria for Solid Tumors (RECIST)
measure.description: Duration of OR was analyzed in the subset of patients who achieved an OR. The duration of OR was defined as the time from the initial CR or PR until documented PD or death. Lesions were assessed by computed tomography (CT), magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), or ultrasound every 9 weeks.
measure.population: Subset of the intent-to-treat population: All patients randomized to treatment who achieved an objective response.

outcome.title: Overall Survival
outcome.description: Overall survival was defined as the time from randomization to death from any cause.
outcome.time_frame: From randomization through July 19, 2013 (up to 6 years, 3 months)
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat population: All patients randomized to treatment (242 patients in each treatment group).

group.title: Carboplatin and Gemcitabine + Bevacizumab
group.description: Carboplatin (AUC 4 mg/mL/minute) was administered intravenously (IV) on Day 1 of each of six 21-day treatment cycles. The carboplatin dose was calculated to reach a target area under the curve (AUC) of concentration x time according to the Calvert formula. Gemcitabine 1000 mg/m^2 was administered IV on Days 1 and Day 8 of each of the six 21-day treatment cycles. Bevacizumab 15 mg/kg was administered IV on Day 1 of each of the six 21-day treatment cycles. The bevacizumab dose was based on the patient's weight at baseline and remained the same throughout the study.

group.title: Carboplatin and Gemcitabine + Placebo
group.description: Carboplatin (AUC 4 mg/mL/minute) was administered intravenously (IV) on Day 1 of each of six 21-day treatment cycles. The carboplatin dose was calculated to reach a target area under the curve (AUC) of concentration x time according to the Calvert formula. Gemcitabine 1000 mg/m^2 was administered IV on Days 1 and Day 8 of each of the six 21-day treatment cycles. Placebo was administered by IV on Day 1 of each of the six 21-day treatment cycles.

measure.title: Overall Survival
measure.description: Overall survival was defined as the time from randomization to death from any cause.
measure.population: Intent-to-treat population: All patients randomized to treatment (242 patients in each treatment group).

analysis.p_value_desc: Summaries of duration of overall survival (median, percentiles) were estimated from Kaplan-Meier curves. The 95% confidence interval for the median was computed using the method of Brookmeyer and Crowley.
analysis.method_desc: The analysis was stratified for time since the last platinum therapy (≤12, >12 months) and cytoreductive surgery for recurrent disease (Yes, No).
analysis.estimate_desc: The hazard ratio was estimated using Cox regression. The hazard ratio is relative to the carboplatin and gemcitabine + placebo group.

outcome.title: Percentage of Patients Who Had a Gastrointestinal Perforation (GIP)
outcome.description: A gastrointestinal perforation is a hole that develops through the entire wall of the stomach, small intestine, large bowel, or gallbladder.
outcome.time_frame: From randomization through September 17, 2010 (up to 3 years, 5 months)
outcome.population: Safety population: All patients who received at least 1 dose of protocol treatment. Due to errors in drug administration, the safety population included 247 patients in the carboplatin and gemcitabine + bevacizumab group and 233 patients in the carboplatin and gemcitabine + placebo group.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Study being conducted under this Agreement is part of the Overall Study. Investigator is free to publish in reputable journals or to present at professional conferences the results of the Study, but only after the first publication or presentation that involves the Overall Study. The Sponsor may request that Confidential Information be deleted and/or the publication be postponed in order to protect the Sponsor's intellectual property rights.
